when I was young I didn't really

of
uh being it was hard to focus it I
didn't have a lot of
confidence and um and people were always

like you'd be doing problem sets with

uh and that's
complicated so I I actually uh I I've
been there a long time I've been at
Harvard for 20 two years and uh the
thing I really like about the physics
department there is that
uh everybody is so um confident and
everybody think has such a high opinion
of themselves that they don't really
worry about you they're not threatened
by me at all um except when I try try
and be really threatening some of them
are smaller than I am um but but but
that's what that's one thing that I
really like about it you know and the
other thing is uh you know I was the
first woman there and they they had a
little problem I mean the first woman
who had tenure so I was the first woman
who went to for instance a a senior
faculty meeting of the senior faculty
and I remember uh after a few faculty
meetings a professor came up to me and
said you know it might be a little
easier for everyone if you just talked
less uh because we're really not used
to having a woman at all in the room and
then one who talks so much is a it's a
little bit disconcerting so that was
interesting
um uh people people have been generally

less
